title: Easeout Weekly #9
body:
Frontend News aims to keep you updated with what's happening in the world of web dev! With the latest news and resources from the design & development community.
![Form Inputs Calendar](/images/uploads/input-date.png) [Better Form Inputs for Better Mobile User Experiences](https://css-tricks.com/better-form-inputs-for-better-mobile-user-experiences/) This article looks at some examples and best practices we can use to create better user experiences on mobile devices. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/better-form-inputs-for-better-mobile-user-experiences/)
![CSS Happy Emoji](/images/uploads/css-emojis.png) [CSS Emojis](https://codepen.io/farmok/full/jOPeQxN) Farid Mokraoui created this neat pen of animated CSS emojis. [See it ➡️](https://codepen.io/farmok/full/jOPeQxN)
![Custom Properties & CSS Logos](/images/uploads/fem-sidebar-css.png) [Creating Color Themes With Custom Properties, HSL, and a Little calc()](https://css-tricks.com/creating-color-themes-with-custom-properties-hsl-and-a-little-calc/) Theming a website with CSS custom properties is much easier than the workaround approaches we’ve resorted to in the past. Check out this handy tutorial! [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/creating-color-themes-with-custom-properties-hsl-and-a-little-calc/)
![CSS Scrollbar With Progress Meter](/images/uploads/scrollbar-progress.png) [CSS Scrollbar With Progress Meter](https://css-tricks.com/css-scrollbar-with-progress-meter/) This article shows how we can use some CSS trickery to make a progress scrollbar. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/css-scrollbar-with-progress-meter/)
![CSS Motion Path Example](/images/uploads/responsive-motion-path.png) [Create a Responsive CSS Motion Path? Sure We Can!](https://css-tricks.com/create-a-responsive-css-motion-path-sure-we-can/) This neat tutorial by Jhey Tompkins shows how to make a CSS motion path responsive. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/create-a-responsive-css-motion-path-sure-we-can/)
![Visual Studio Diagram](/images/uploads/visual-studio-guide.png) [Visual Studio Code: A Power User’s Guide](https://www.sitepoint.com/visual-studio-code-power-user-guide) In this guide, you’ll learn how to take advantage of Visual Studio Code to supercharge your development workflow. [Read it ➡️](https://www.sitepoint.com/visual-studio-code-power-user-guide)
![Vue Circles Logo](/images/uploads/vue-circles.jpg) [How the Vue Composition API Replaces Vue Mixins](https://css-tricks.com/how-the-vue-composition-api-replaces-vue-mixins/) This article looks at the drawbacks of mixins and sees how the Composition API overcomes them and allows Vue applications to be far more scalable. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/how-the-vue-composition-api-replaces-vue-mixins/)
![Best Practices With React Hooks](/images/uploads/react-hooks-best-practices.png) [Best Practices With React Hooks](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/react-hooks-best-practices/) This article covers the rules of React Hooks and how to effectively start using them in your projects. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/react-hooks-best-practices/)
![Text Inside a Circle](/images/uploads/text-inside-circle.png) [Using CSS to Set Text Inside a Circle](https://css-tricks.com/using-css-to-set-text-inside-a-circle/) A nice tutorial on how to set a block of text inside of a circle using plain CSS. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/using-css-to-set-text-inside-a-circle/)
![A Particle Trail Animation](/images/uploads/3-partical-trail-animation-javascript.png) [How To Create A Particle Trail Animation In JavaScript](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/particle-trail-animation-javascript/) Particle animations belong to the most impressive animations that exist. In this article, Anna Prenzel will explain how you can to easily program a small trail of particles with anime.js. [Read it ➡️](https://www.smashingmagazine.com/2020/04/particle-trail-animation-javascript/)
![Marc Grabanski Image](/images/uploads/frontend-mastery.png) [Frontend Masterery With Marc Grabanski](https://shoptalkshow.com/408/) Mark talks about what Frontend Masters is, who it's for, how they decide what to teach, what's coming up, and the question everyone asks: what do I learn next? [Listen up ➡️](https://shoptalkshow.com/408/)
![ CSS Shadow Parts](/images/uploads/intersecting-parts.png) [Styling in the Shadow DOM With CSS Shadow Parts](https://css-tricks.com/styling-in-the-shadow-dom-with-css-shadow-parts/) Safari 13.1 just shipped support for CSS Shadow Parts! We’ll see why it’s useful, but first we'll see a recap of shadow DOM encapsulation. [Read it ➡️](https://css-tricks.com/styling-in-the-shadow-dom-with-css-shadow-parts/)
## Previous Issue: * [Easeout Weekly #8](https://www.easeout.co/blog/2020-04-12-easeout-weekly-8)
short: A weekly roundup of the latest web design & development news.
